posts.name: csos
posts.cooked:
Hello, this year we decided to use yagsl 2025, we had a few problems but we solved them all thanks to yagsl’s beautiful documentation. but now we have encountered a new problem (this may not be a problem) our problem is that we cannot set the PID of the drive motor for some reason or maybe the drive motor may have another problem or there may be a code error, so we wanted to ask you. below I will leave you the YAGSL configuration settings, codes and a video.

configs:

controllerproperties.json

physicalproperties.json

pidfproperties.json

frontleft.json (the same with other modules)

code (that I thought might be important)

RobotContainer.java

SwerveSubsystem.java

note : continuation same as YAGSL -EXAMPLE

video : the video will be deleted in 2 days, I’ll change the link again after 2 days

We are using MK4I L2 modules and Neo drive and Neo rotation and NavX

Our problem: Drive motor is not working properly. We have worked a lot with PID , it has definitely gotten better but it is not taking a healthy shape. We wanted to ask if we made a mistake somewhere else. Should we continue to adjust PID and if necessary, what advice can you give?
Our team was having a similar issue, check out this thread for more info: Swerve (yagsl) - #13 by enishangck . Apparently there is a fix in the latest beta but we have not tested it.

Like @weepfrog said there is an attempt at a fix in the latest beta that you can install at

If you do test it, let us know that it works so we can add it to the changelog!
We will also be attempting this tommorow.

posts.name: Prince
posts.cooked: Is the latest update 2025.2.1 or is there a newer one?

posts.name: Prince
posts.cooked:
public Command sysIdDriveMotorCommand() { return SwerveDriveTest.generateSysIdCommand( SwerveDriveTest.setDriveSysIdRoutine( new Config(), this, swerveDrive, 12,true), 3.0, 5.0, 3.0); }

With this new sys id method. Would i run the “setDriveSysIdRoutine” Method for both angle and drive, but change the Boolean to true if it is for angle instead of drive.
You would set tit to true to spin the robot in place for sysid thus requiring no half field to get tuned values

posts.name: Prince
posts.cooked: We ran sysID on our robot last night. Our tuned kp drive values seemed to around 1 which seems normal and pretty close to the starting value for our drivebase. But when we ran our angle test we got our tuned kp values ranging from 200 - 1000 and it seems to be too extreme to work from our testing. Are we supposed to use the replacefeedforwardmethod to plug the ks,kv and ka values too or is there something wrong with our test?

You are supposed to use the replaceFeedForward to use your new ks,kv, and ka.

There might not be anything wrong with your test; i haven’t thoroughly tested sysid yet for the pid values. I believe i may need to change some of the logging.

In general i do not recommend running sysid for your angle motors yet, bc this could wear down your tread fast

posts.name: Prince
posts.cooked: Would i use the ks,kv,ka values from my drive test or angle test. When we drive and rotate at the same time the movement isnt ideal it starts to jitter and jump back and forth. Do you have any ideas on why this is would happen. I will send more details and videos tonight for better explanation

From your drive test. When your drive test happens your robot should spinn at increasing speeds, then stop, the spin fast and slow down.

The jittering can be caused by a dead or dying battery. Reduce the voltage to test in the config if it happens on all of your battery’s

posts.name: csos
posts.cooked:
nstrike:

2025.2.1-beta4

Hello, we tried version 2025.2.1-beta4. Drive motor is fixed. Everything works without any problems.

note : the previous version was version 2025.1.1
